Define.Name: ENABLE_NESTED_INTERRUPTS
Define.Description: Allows interrupts to occur while the kernel is handling an user interrupt e.g a syscall. Strongly recommended for Real-Time Systems!

Define.Name: HAS_PROCFS_ENABLED
Define.Description: Enables the debug device /proc/info which can be read to get information on the running system.

Define.Name: USE_WORKERTASK
Define.Description: Enables the use of the workertask which allows the scheduling of interrupts. Important for Real-Time Systems. Use in combination with NUM_WORKERTHREADS.

Define.Name: NUM_WORKERTHREADS
Define.Description: The amount of workerthreads that shall be available. Keep as small as small as possible since every workerthread needs its own stack but as big enough to handle all interrupts and periodic or timed functionalities (e.g ARP resending a.s.o.).

Define.Name: LOG_TASK_SPACE_START
Define.Description: The logical (virtual) address the memory space a tasks starts at. (Only used if HAT_LAYER is available)

Define.Name: NUM_ADDRESS_PROTOCOLS
Define.Description: Do not modify. Its automatically modified if you change the protocols inside the Protocols Section.

Define.Name: NUM_TRANSPORT_PROTOCOLS
Define.Description: Do not modify. Its automatically modified if you change the protocols inside the Protocols Section.

Define.Name: USE_SIMPLEADDRESSPROTOCOL
Define.Description: Do not modify. Its automatically modified if you change the protocols inside the Protocols Section.

Define.Name: USE_ARP
Define.Description: Do not modify. Its automatically modified if you change the protocols inside the Protocols Section.

Define.Name: USE_SIMPLETRANSPORTPROTOCOL
Define.Description: Do not modify. Its automatically modified if you change the protocols inside the Protocols Section.

Define.Name: MMIO_START_ADDRESS
Define.Description: The start address of the memory mapped I/O. (Only used if HAT_LAYER is available)

Define.Name: MMIO_AREA_LENGTH
Define.Description: The length of the MMIO area. All MMIO devices have to fit into this area! (Only used if HAT_LAYER is available)

Define.Name: ICACHE_ENABLE
Define.Description: Enables the instruction cache (harvard architectures).

Define.Name: DCACHE_ENABLE
Define.Description: Enables the data cache (harvard architectures).

Define.Name: DEFAULT_USER_STACK_SIZE
Define.Description: The default size in bytes of a stack for a newly created thread.

Define.Name: STACK_GROWS_DOWNWARDS
Define.Description: Indicates whether the stack pointer is decremented or incremented on this architecture.

Define.Name: RESERVED_BYTES_FOR_STACKFRAME
Define.Description: The minimal size of a stack frame.

Define.Name: CLEAR_THREAD_STACKS
Define.Description: Enables the clearing of the stack memory area whenever a thread is created. (Slows down the system a little bit)

Define.Name: WORKERTHREAD_STACK_SIZE
Define.Description: The stack size for a workerthread.

Define.Name: WORKERTHREAD_UART_PRIORITY_PARAM
Define.Description: The priority (parameter) for a workerthread handling an UART interrupt.

Define.Name: WORKERTHREAD_ETH_PRIORITY_PARAM
Define.Description: The priority (parameter) for a workerthread handling an ETH interrupt.

Define.Name: USE_SAFE_KERNEL_STACKS
Define.Description: Enabling this feature will cause every thread executing in kernel space (e.g whenever a syscall is handled) to use a new stack unaccessable from user space so no stack sniffing can be done.

Define.Name: KERNEL_STACK_SIZE
Define.Description: If USE_SAFE_KERNEL_STACKS is set this define sets the size of the kernel stacks.

Define.Name: __DEBUG__
Define.Description: Allows general debug messages. Will enable the ASSERT() statements.

Define.Name: __EARLY_SERIAL_SUPPORT__
Define.Description: Will cause the serial device to be initialized first which allows debug or logging messages to be printed earlier.

Define.Name: QEMU_HACK
Define.Description: Use other assembler instructions for QEMU on PPC to enable interrupts

Define.Name: SHM_START
Define.Description: Start of shared memory area used for multiprocessor communication
